Laplace Junior Professor Chair in Data Science

Postdoctoral Program

The Ecole Normale Sup√©rieure (ENS Paris) invites applications for a Junior Research and Teaching Laplace chair in data science at the postdoctoral level, funded by the CFM (Capital Fund Management) and the ENS.

The Laplace chair takes its name for the famous mathematician Pierre-Simon, marquis de Laplace who, between many acomplishments, was one of the founder of statistical inference. The chair aims at recruiting outstanding candidates in all areas of data sciences including theoretical statistics, machine learning, signal processing, computer science, applied mathematics and statistical physics, or working on applications to other sciences such as physics, biology, medecine or social sciences and economics.

Appointments will be for two years with a possible extension for a third year. Salary is competitive, according to international experience and qualification.

The successful candidates will carry out (deep) research and reduced teaching (which will be adapted) at the ENS. Applications should consist of a single file and should be send before November 30th, 2016 by email.

Applications should consist of:

  • A cover letter ;
  • A complete CV including a list of publications ;
  • A research statement (maximum 4 pages in A4 format) with potential interactions with research groups/faculty within the different departments of ENS (Computer science, Mathematics, Physics, Biology, etc.) ;
  • Three letters of recommendation from senior scientists, to be sent directly and separatly to by email .

More information about the scientific environnement of this program can be found on the webpage of the Data Science Chaire of the ENS.

Short-listed candidates will be invited for an interview (video conference) in mid-January 2016.
